phrase: It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.
author: Albus Dumbledore

phrase: Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable of both inflicting injury, and remedying it.
author: Albus Dumbledore

phrase: You're a little scary sometimes, you know that? Brilliant, but scary.
author: Hermione Granger

phrase: And now, Harry, let us step out into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.
author: Albus Dumbledore

phrase: Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right.
author: Hermione Granger

phrase: It is the qualify of one's convictions that determines success, not the number of followers.
author: Remus Lupin

phrase: We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
author: Sirius Black

phrase: Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.
author: Albus Dumbledore

phrase: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.
author: The Marauders

phrase: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies,but just as much to stand up to our friends.
author: Albus Dumbledore

phrase: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: Albus Dumbledore
